greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of palindromic primes in base 2 with exactly n binary digits.
comment: Every palindrome with an even number of digits is divisible by 11 (in base 2), i.e. by 3 in base 10, and therefore is composite (not prime). Hence there is only one palindromic prime with an even number of digits, namely 11_2 = 3_{10}.
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..76
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Palindromic Prime.
results.author: _Martin Renner_, Apr 15 2006
